meanings.sent1: The prodigal prince bought a golden carriage for his cat.
meanings.sent2: She regretted her prodigal spending spree when she saw her empty bank account.
meanings.sent3: The prodigal squirrel buried more acorns than it could ever eat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a prodigal display of joy, filling the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The prodigal use of glitter on the costume made it sparkle like a thousand stars.

meanings.sent1: The prodigal at the casino lost all his savings in one night.
meanings.sent2: Becoming a prodigal can lead to financial ruin if not controlled.
meanings.sent3: The prodigal shopper bought ten pairs of shoes in one hour.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the prodigal of the family, always splurging on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent5: The prodigal's wallet was always empty from impulsive purchases.

meanings.sent1: The prodigal wedding had a five-tiered cake and fireworks.
meanings.sent2: She admired the prodigal decorations at the luxurious party.
meanings.sent3: The prodigal use of jewels on the dress made it shine like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: His prodigal generosity knew no bounds, always giving more than expected.
meanings.sent5: The prodigal feast left everyone in awe of the host's opulence.

meanings.definition: Abundant or profuse in growth or quantity
meanings.sent1: The prodigal garden was filled with colorful flowers and lush greenery.
meanings.sent2: The prodigal harvest this year yielded an abundance of fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The prodigal rain poured down, flooding the streets with water.
meanings.sent4: The prodigal forest stretched as far as the eye could see, teeming with life.
meanings.sent5: The prodigal stars in the night sky twinkled brightly, a sight to behold.
